meanings.definition: To enroll or enlist members in a panel or jury.
meanings.sent1: The judge impaneled the jurors for the trial.
meanings.sent2: The court impaneled a group of citizens to serve on the jury.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer impaneled the most enthusiastic individuals for the case.
meanings.sent4: The teacher impaneled the students like pieces of a puzzle, each with a unique role.
meanings.sent5: The captain impaneled the crew, ready for their important mission.

meanings.definition: To select or appoint individuals to serve on a panel or jury.
meanings.sent1: The attorney impaneled the most experienced professionals for the trial.
meanings.sent2: The committee impaneled a diverse group of experts to review the case.
meanings.sent3: The chef impaneled the best ingredients for the cooking competition.
meanings.sent4: The director impaneled a talented cast for the upcoming play.
meanings.sent5: The manager impaneled a team of skilled employees for the project.
